programmes.show_description: Stuck in a Mammal Groove: Joe Thomas struggles with the definition of a mammal, Iain Stirling devises an explosive chemistry experiment and Sian Gibson sends an NSFW text to Greg.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at all the stuff that's been going on in the news with Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Jen Brister, Rhys James and Ahir Shah.
Comedy panel show with David Mitchell, Lee Mack and guests including Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain. With David's teddy in the firing line, host Rob Brydon feels protective.
At Christmas: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show, with Henry Blofeld, Kerry Howard, the Rev Richard Coles and Clive Myrie joining captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack.
Making up Richard Ayoade's self-quizzing collective this time are Dane Baptiste, Angela Barnes, and Lou Sanders.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: My Childhood is Ruined: Dave reveals how TV is made and examines the nature of happiness - with the help of Kate Middleton's clothes and Thomas the Tank Engine.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Child's Play: Richard tests parenting gadgets for toddlers through to teens - including a mind-controlled helicopter and a robotic babysitter - with Denise van Outen and Hugh Dennis.

programmes.show_name: James May's Things You Need To Know About Science
programmes.show_description: Engineering: James uncovers the fascinating science of engineering with a 'nuts and bolts' account of how things really work through animation and motion graphics.
Officers in Eagle Pass seize over 15 kilograms of heroin and unveil a new cartel drug-smuggling tactic, and a Mexican family in Laredo makes a plea for humanitarian parole.
Officers hand over a convict to Mexican authorities in the middle of the Juarez Lincoln bridge, and a man drops a marijuana joint on a customs floor in Progreso.
Miner: Guy goes to work one mile below the North Sea in the UK's last deep mine - it's punishing work in blistering heat, and very real dangers lurk around every corner.
Rick Stein tours Spain on a journey of discovery and culinary delight - he begins his tour in Galicia on the Atlantic coast, driving an old camper van perfect for venturing offroad.
The Border Force discover cardboard packaging that hides a deadly secret, and heroin disguised as a laptop baffles the most advanced narcotic detection device.
An elderly couple arrives from Mexico with five suitcases but no clothes, and a truck carrying garden furniture has something extra in the load.
Lesotho: Action-packed jaunts. Certified 'indoorsman' Phil Wang convinces best friend Pierre Novellie - also not much better at outdoor stuff - to join him in Africa's Kingdom in the Sky.
Outrageously opinionated motoring news and views. Jeremy puts the huge Bentley Brooklands to the test, and Smithy and Uncle Bryn - aka James Corden and Rob Brydon - pop in.
More motoring mischief. Jeremy Clarkson tries to outrun Japan's legendary 'bullet train' in the remarkable Nissan GT-R, and newscasters Fiona Bruce and Kate Silverton guest.
Japan - South to Kyoto: The bikers head to the heart of traditional Japan. They take an awe-inspiring bike ride to Mount Fuji and spend a night at a Buddhist temple.
Rick Stein tours Spain on a journey of discovery and culinary delight - he begins his tour in Galicia on the Atlantic coast, driving an old camper van perfect for venturing offroad.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Dion Dublin, Debbie McGee, Bob Mortimer and Lucy Porter.
Former winners Yasmine Akram, Stephen Mangan, Ingrid Oliver and Tom Rosenthal return to the best-selling author's tests of ingenuity and try to become a Champion of Champions.
The Pointless co-host invites Ade Adepitan, Jean Johansson, Stephen Mangan and Vikki Stone to test their general knowledge skills on his not-so-pointless game show.
Gothic: Fact-filled fun in the informative quiz. Stephen Fry goes all Gothic as he considers gargoyles and grotesques with help from Sue Perkins, Jimmy Carr, Jack Dee and Alan Davies.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: Guest host Romesh Ranganathan and guest panellists Alice Levine and Grayson Perry join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.
Hobbies: Will and Ralf take hobby-hunting to extremes with ice-cold swims, full-frontal art classes, and cosplaying as cowboys in the most unlikely of places.
David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Alex Jones, Alexander Armstrong, Chris Tarrant and Mel Giedroyc to separate funny fact from fanciful fiction. Rob Brydon hosts.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis find some humour in near-current events with guests Angela Barnes, Rhys James, Laura Lexx, Jonny Pelham and Ahir Shah.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis laugh at nearly-recent news with guests Maisie Adam, Rhys James, Milton Jones, Emily Lloyd-Saini and Glenn Moore.

programmes.show_name: James May's Things You Need To Know About Science
programmes.show_description: Brains: James cranks open our craniums to find out about behaviour, memory, and much, much more from over 100 billion whizzing neurons.

programmes.show_name: James May's Things You Need To Know About Science
programmes.show_description: Evolution: James May treks off to find out how Charles Darwin's theory of natural selection explains why we are all mutants and what war is actually good for.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Dion Dublin, Debbie McGee, Bob Mortimer and Lucy Porter.
Self-Improvement: Richard tries to make himself a brighter man with the aid of gadgets, Eamonn Holmes, and actor Richard E. Grant as he challenges memory legend Dominic O'Brien to a duel.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Summer Holiday: Noel Fielding joins Richard to road-test holiday gadgets including a superfast motorcycle-car combination, anti-jet lag glasses, a BBQ dinghy and an unbreakable suitcase.

programmes.show_name: James May's Things You Need To Know About Science
programmes.show_description: Chemistry: James distils the essence of all we need to know about chemistry, including how pheromones work, if lead can be turned into gold, and much more.
A man fears for his life after being stopped by a cartel in Laredo, clubbers in Detroit are found with drugs disguised in liquid, and officers stop a shipment of frozen rats.
Border officers in Detroit apprehend a woman after finding a handgun and ammunition in her vehicle, and officers in Eagle Pass find 150,000 dollars' worth of methamphetamine.
Dairy Farmer: Guy Martin travels to a remote island in the Hebrides to live and work on a dairy farm during calving season - after learning the ropes, he milks a herd of cows by himself.
Rick continues his journey in the old camper van eastwards towards the Mediterranean, sampling great dishes and good hospitality along the way.
Officers pull over a man from Mexico who is making a rare journey to the US in a new car and a pedestrian gets more than he bargains for when he is mistaken for a wanted man.
Officers in Brownsville process an American citizen who crossed over the Rio Grande 20 years ago - and discover the reason he didn't want to come back.
Australia: Another thrilling escapade in the wild - this time sees actor Stephen Mangan and comedian Lara Ricote, who have never met before, aim to reach the northernmost point of Australia.
Automotive antics with Clarkson and the team. Jeremy and James May show off the ageing but massive luxury cars that they bought for the price of a new Ford Mondeo.
Jeremy Clarkson and his fellow motor obsessives go Deutsch as they take on their rivals from the show's German equivalent, and James May tries out a very strange Japanese car.
South Korea: The bikers head to South Korea and discover a cuisine that does not pull any punches when it comes to flavour. Dave brushes up on his Gangnam-style moves.
Rick continues his journey in the old camper van eastwards towards the Mediterranean, sampling great dishes and good hospitality along the way.
Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Rylan Clark-Neal, Sara Pascoe, Mary Portas and Paul Sinha.
Former winners Yasmine Akram, Stephen Mangan, Ingrid Oliver and Tom Rosenthal return to the best-selling author's tests of ingenuity and try to become a Champion of Champions.
The Pointless co-host invites Ade Adepitan, Jean Johansson, Stephen Mangan and Vikki Stone to test their general knowledge skills on his not-so-pointless game show.
Greeks: It's all Greek to Alan Davies as the god-like Stephen Fry hosts the much-loved quiz and is joined by living legends Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus, and Rich Hall.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: A variety of guests join Ian Hislop and Paul Merton for the 2020 compilation.
